data.title: Permanent Residency
data.summary: Express Entry, CEC, PNPs, H&C — tailored strategies to transition to Canadian permanent residency.

blocks.Title: Permanent Residency
blocks.Subtitle: Your pathway to calling Canada home
blocks.description: We guide skilled workers, international graduates, temporary residents, and families through Canada’s permanent residency pathways — including Express Entry, Canadian Experience Class, Provincial Nominee Programs, pilots, and H&C. From eligibility and CRS optimization to complete documentation, we help you transition to PR with confidence.

blocks.Heading: Explore Your Pathway to Permanent Residence
Explore Your Pathway to Permanent Residence

Cards.title: Express Entry System
Cards.description: FSW, CEC, and FST applications managed via CRS ranking; top candidates receive ITAs and often obtain PR in ~6 months.

Cards.title: Provincial Nominee Programs
Cards.description: Province-specific pathways (except Quebec) for workers, graduates, semi-skilled workers, and entrepreneurs — via Express Entry or direct nomination.

Cards.title: International Graduate Streams
Cards.description: Canadian graduates can fast-track PR through CEC or province-specific International Graduate streams under PNP.

Cards.title: Rural & Northern Immigration Pilot (RNIP/RCIP)
Cards.description: Community-driven programs help candidates with job offers settle in smaller towns and transition to PR.

Cards.title: Agri-Food & Home Care Worker Pilots
Cards.description: Sector-focused routes for eligible agri-food workers and caregivers that can lead to permanent residency.

Cards.title: H&C & Public Policy Pathways
Cards.description: Permanent residency options for exceptional circumstances outside standard economic programs.

Cards.description: Choose the best federal or provincial route — Express Entry, CEC, PNPs, RNIP and more — aligned to your goals.
